patterns.name: consensus_manufacturing
patterns.description: Creating illusion of widespread agreement on controversial topics

examples.text: Experts overwhelmingly agree that the new policy is necessary for public safety
examples.analysis: Classic consensus manufacturing - using unnamed 'experts' to present controversial policy as settled fact

patterns.counter_analysis: Question which experts, their funding sources, and what contrary evidence is being ignored

patterns.name: false_balance
patterns.description: Presenting established facts as merely one side of a debate

examples.text: While official sources maintain X, some critics suggest Y
examples.analysis: Using 'balance' to cast doubt on verified information or introduce fringe theories as equally valid

patterns.counter_analysis: Examine the evidence for each position, not just the fact that disagreement exists

patterns.name: authority_citation
patterns.description: Using unnamed or vague authority figures to support claims

examples.text: Sources familiar with the matter indicate that significant progress has been made
examples.analysis: Using anonymous sources to shape perception without accountability

patterns.counter_analysis: Always ask which specific sources and what their potential biases might be

patterns.name: emotional_manipulation
patterns.description: Using emotionally charged language to override critical thinking

examples.text: Fears are growing among experts about the potential consequences of this development
examples.analysis: Combining appeal to authority with fear to create emotional response

patterns.counter_analysis: Focus on actual facts and evidence rather than emotional reactions
